speaker: EVELYN MOUNTJOY
line: Happy, stop that.

speaker: EVELYN MOUNTJOY
line: Hap. What's with her all of a sudden?

speaker: EVELYN MOUNTJOY
line: Don't you look at my letters.

speaker: DARREN MOUNTJOY
line: For God's sake.

speaker: DARREN MOUNTJOY
line: Read 'em and weep my dear!

speaker: EVELYN MOUNTJOY
line: Seven letters. 50 bonus points.

speaker: EVELYN MOUNTJOY
line: Darren...

speaker: DARREN MOUNTJOY
line: Get in the basement.

speaker: EVELYN MOUNTJOY
line: What are you going to do?

speaker: DARREN MOUNTJOY
line: Just do what I say.

speaker: DARREN MOUNTJOY
line: I got a gun!

speaker: DARREN MOUNTJOY
line: Stop!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Reyes! Sorry, I didn't mean to scare you.

speaker: REYES
line: They told me I'd find you inside.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I was out back talking to the Detective in charge. You're the expert here, Monica. Everyone's waiting to hear what you have to say on this.

speaker: REYES
line: What do we know?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Darren and Evelyn Mountjoy, married thirty-two years, three kids, five grand-kids. Not an enemy in the world. Just that dog out front. Neck's broken. Footprints in the mud. We're looking for two perps.

speaker: REYES
line: Nothing's soiled in the house, nothing at all to suggest motive.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, it all fits the profile, right? This thing is staged to look like some kind of Satanic ritual.

speaker: REYES
line: Placing victims in a suicide posture is ritualistic. And this word is undoubtedly Satanic.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Daemonicus.

speaker: REYES
line: It means Satan in Latin, or Daemonicus - Demon Possession.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: And it's worth 50 extra points. That's why they were posed like this. You think these folks were possessed, right?

speaker: REYES
line: That would be the textbook explanation

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Then I'll let 'em know.

speaker: REYES
line: This may be something else.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Which is what?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey, you say anything you want about Satanic ritual, but don't tell me you think the Devil did this, because we've got prints from out there. This case ain't even close to being an X-File.

speaker: REYES
line: Something strange happened in here just before you came in. I can't explain it.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Arghh!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Dana Scully. I have just been assigned to the Academy as a forensic investigator. For the past eight years I was part of a unit known as the X-Files. Some of you may have heard of it.

speaker: CADET
line: Ever slay a vampire?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sorry to disappoint you, but this is a course in forensic pathology. Hard science. An X-File is a case that has been deemed unsolvable by the Bureau, because such a case cannot be solved it may beg other explanations... a vampire, perhaps. Science, however, tells us that evil comes not from monsters, but from men. It offers us the methodology to catch these men, and only after we have exhausted these methods should we leave science behind to consider more extreme possibilities.

speaker: REYES
line: What did you find?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I asked Agent Scully for expertise on this. Looks like we can rule out the Exorcist after all.

speaker: REYES
line: And why is that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There is adhesive residue on Mrs. Mountjoy's wrists and face. Do you see that? She was taped and bound and then shot at a range of ten to twelve feet with her husband's handgun.

speaker: REYES
line: The husband shot her.

speaker: REYES
line: He was tricked into it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's what we're thinking. Some kind of sick game.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, there's also evidence of fingerprint bruising along his collarbone.

speaker: REYES
line: They held him down. Shot him in his chair.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Again, we're looking for two guys.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Snakes appeared to be purely symbolic. They're non-venomous species collected locally. They were sewn post-mortem into the body cavity with household thread, by someone who appears to have surgical skill.

speaker: REYES
line: You've made a lot of headway.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But there's something else. There's something that you're not saying.

speaker: REYES
line: When I was alone in that house this morning I had the strong feeling I was in the presence of evil.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Look, Monica, the only reason you were called in on this thing is you've investigated hundreds of these kinds of cases.

speaker: REYES
line: And not once did I find anything to support evidence of genuine Satanic activity.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm saying...

speaker: REYES
line: I've never felt this before.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Excuse me. John Doggett

speaker: REYES
line: Agent Scully, have you ever sensed what I'm talking about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've felt things that I couldn't understand. Things that I was afraid to admit even to myself.

speaker: REYES
line: And what did you do?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I learned not to ignore it... to trust my instincts.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: nan

speaker: REYES
line: What is it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mental hospital, 100 miles from here. They think one of their patients did this.

speaker: DR. SAMPSON
line: We're pretty shaken up. We're still trying to figure out how he could have escaped.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Why do you think this escaped patient Dr. Richmond was involved in these murders?

speaker: DR. SAMPSON
line: Dr. Richmond was committed here because he killed three patients. He'd sewn strychnine tablets in their stomach lining in. And I heard about the snakes.

speaker: REYES
line: The police believe two men committed this crime, Dr. Sampson.

speaker: DR. SAMPSON
line: Two men?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Do you have any idea who the second man might be?

speaker: DR. SAMPSON
line: No, he didn't exactly keep pen-pals.

speaker: REYES
line: Did Dr. Richmond display any knowledge of Satanic lure, or speak of demonic possession?

speaker: DR. SAMPSON
line: No, he was perfectly cogent. He didn't suffer from those kinds of delusions.

speaker: REYES
line: I'm not really asking about delusions.

speaker: REYES
line: When you last spoke to him did he seem himself?

speaker: DR. SAMPSON
line: Seem himself?

speaker: REYES
line: I mean did he display personality other than his own? Speaking tongues or in any language which he didn't know?

speaker: DR. SAMPSON
line: You're asking me if he was possessed? This is the 21th century, Miss Reyes. We stopped looking a long time ago to demons to explain mental illness.

speaker: REYES
line: I'm not really talking about mental illness.

speaker: DR. SAMPSON
line: Excuse me a moment.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know, Monica, a room here just came open.

speaker: REYES
line: You heard what she said. Dr. Richmond didn't know anything about Satanic ritual.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: And that proves he was possessed?

speaker: REYES
line: You explain to me how else he commits a crime that's a perfect example of it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well let's try the obvious - it was his accomplice.

speaker: DR. SAMPSON
line: Agents... I, uh, think the man you're looking for might be Paul Gerlach.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Is he a patient here?

speaker: DR. SAMPSON
line: No, he's a guard. He's been here for 12 years and no one can find him.

speaker: REYES
line: Who would be the last person who saw them together?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mr. Kobold? My name is John Doggett, this is Monica Reyes. We're with the FBI.

speaker: REYES
line: The patient in the cell next to you escaped last night. Did you see or hear anything? You share the same guard, Mr. Kobold. Do you know anything about their relationship? Why he would have helped him to escape?

speaker: KOBOLD
line: You mean than the guard forced a patient to escape, or did the patient force the guard? Or are they both of

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know something about this, Mr. Kobold? If you do we need your help. To stop them before they hurt more people.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: You're too late for that.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: If you're afraid to help us, Mr. Kobold, we can protect you. No harm will come to you.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: Do you believe in the power of the Devil, Mr. Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I believe that the Devil's a story made up to scare people.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: Then how can you possibly protect me?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Consider the source, Monica.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: Daemonicus. Daemonicus. Dae...

speaker: DR. SAMPSON
line: He's been calling for Agent Doggett for the past hour. He's extremely agitated.

speaker: REYES
line: Has he said why?

speaker: DR. SAMPSON
line: He keeps saying "Prince of the Apostles" over and over again. I don't know what it means. I had to restrain him for his own safety and I thought it was best not to sedate him until you speak to him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mr. Kobold, it's John Doggett.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: He's speaking to me. Whispering in my ear.

speaker: REYES
line: What's he saying to you, Mr. Kobold?

speaker: KOBOLD
line: He's... killed again.

speaker: REYES
line: Who?

speaker: KOBOLD
line: I don't know. But I can show you.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: You can't know what it feels like, being free of that cage, and to see the sky above me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Right, where is he, Mr. Kobold?

speaker: KOBOLD
line: There, I can take you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's far enough. Take him back to his cage now. Agent Reyes?

speaker: REYES
line: You think he's making it up?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah.

speaker: REYES
line: That was a pretty convincing show back there.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He's play-acting, Monica. Just because he's good at it doesn't make it true.

speaker: REYES
line: Why do it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He wanted some fresh air. Maybe he gets off sending the FBI on snipe hunts.

speaker: REYES
line: I don't think that's it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This is the security guard, Paul Gerlach.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It appears he was shot in the chest. His body was staged post-mortem, just like the others.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Someone wants to play games.

speaker: REYES
line: Or not. Prince of the Apostles. Kobold kept repeating it in his cell.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Saint Peter. He was said to have been crucified upside down.

speaker: REYES
line: A symbol later adopted by the Satanists to mark the power of Antichrist.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Which you take as proof that the Devil possessed the surgeon who somehow put him in contact with Kobold.

speaker: REYES
line: It's part of the literature. He could be a medium. A willing host for Satan. May be communicating with Kobold.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well that's convenient.

speaker: REYES
line: He brought up the Devil and the snakes. No one told him the details of the crime and yet he knew.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's 'cause he planned it. I pulled his file. This guy's a master manipulator. He was a history Professor at the University of Miami, committed for grinding up six coeds, that he tricked into his basement. He used their flesh as fertiliser in his garden.

speaker: REYES
line: If Kobold's part of this then why is he still behind bars? Why not escape when he had the chance?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't know yet. You believe this guy, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I haven't formed an opinion about it yet, actually.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's great. That's great.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where are you going, Monica?

speaker: REYES
line: This man Kobold can help us, John. I'm going to prove it to you.

speaker: REYES
line: Professor.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: You found the body.

speaker: REYES
line: Yes. Professor Kobold, we need your help. To find him before anyone else gets hurt.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: I can't.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You can't or you won't?

speaker: KOBOLD
line: I can't. In here. He whispers to me in a thousand voices. But they're so hard to hear.

speaker: REYES
line: What can we do, to help you here?

speaker: KOBOLD
line: I need a larger room. One with space. And windows. To see the sky.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're not going along with this are you? Giving this guy what he wants?

speaker: REYES
line: That's my general idea, yeah.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're making a mistake.

speaker: REYES
line: Look, even if you're right, even if this man is faking it, he can help us. I'm not willing to turn my back on that. Are you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's Officer Custer. He's going to keep an eye on you.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: I'm familiar with Officer Custer.

speaker: OFFICER CUSTER
line: I'm outside the door if you need anything, Professor.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: Agent Reyes believes me. But you don't, Mr. Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It doesn't matter what I believe.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: I'm wondering, why a sceptic such as yourself would accept an assignment to an obscure unit of the FBI devoted exclusively to the investigating of paranormal phenomena.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You been checking up on me, Professor?

speaker: KOBOLD
line: Ordinarily men do not pursue occupations against their own inclinations unless there's some strong countervailing reason. Seeking the love or approval of a woman, perhaps? Agent Reyes may have affection for you, but you for her? Of course it could be someone else. Or something else. Some... dark secret from your past.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's enough.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: An unsolved tragedy for which you feel responsible. In some morbid way you haven't even admitted to yourself, perhaps you feel that... chasing ghosts will answer the questions which damn you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't have time for this. Tell me if he says anything.

speaker: OFFICER CUSTER
line: Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Reyes! Get Agent Reyes!

speaker: KOBOLD
line: Me-di-cus, me-diii-cuss.

speaker: REYES
line: He's saying something. Medicus... a physician.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Dr. Sampson?

speaker: REYES
line: John.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Dr. Sampson?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The syringes contained roperidol, that's the same anti-psychotic medication that she was giving to Dr. Richmond.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He's not the one calling the shots.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You still think that it was Kobold?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This is not about demons, it's not about demonic possession, it's about men.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, have you considered that something else might be going on here?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I heard you say, Agent Scully, I heard you tell a classroom full of FBI cadets - most evil in the world comes from men.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But I also said that once science fails, we have to consider extreme possibilities.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know what you're feeling. I know your frustration. But you can't let it cloud your objectivity.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Reyes is thinking just what this guy Kobold wants her to think, and now you are too.

speaker: OFFICER CUSTER
line: Professor, you done with this meal?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I brought something, Professor. Something to read. It's a monograph you wrote six years ago. Know the one I'm talking about, Professor? It's about the influence of Satan in Renaissance thinking.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: So, you found your proof. Circumstantial though it may be.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You planned this whole thing. I want to know why.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: I've been thinking a lot about you, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're not answering my question, Professor.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: About why someone so ill-suited would draw this duty. Clearly, you have feelings for her.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You ordered Dr. Richmond to kill these people, didn't you?

speaker: KOBOLD
line: But you can't compete with the long-lost Agent Mulder. With his easy good looks, his Oxford education.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This is about you, Professor.

speaker: KOBOLD
line: Mulder has what you can't have. What you stumble for. The flat-footed cop, thinking he could put handcuffs on a demon.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Answer the question!

speaker: KOBOLD
line: You want her, but she feels sorry for you. They both do.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Guard! We need a medic! Guard! We need a medic! Guard!

speaker: REYES
line: She's coming.

speaker: SCULLY
line: As far as I can tell physically he's fine.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Of course he is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What brought this on?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The guy's an expert on Satanic history, I, I confronted him on it.

speaker: REYES
line: Which proves what?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Come on, Monica, y-you wanted to know who could stage a textbook example. This guy wrote the damn book!

speaker: REYES
line: I can't explain those voices we heard in his room... or this.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's a trick.

speaker: REYES
line: What if it's ectoplasm?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Ectoplasm?

speaker: REYES
line: You've heard of it, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder used to refer to it as psychic plasma - a residual by-product of telepathic communication. In theory it would have inorganic properties that couldn't be explained otherwise.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So what are we talking now? The Ghostbusters?

speaker: REYES
line: If I'm right an analysis of this sample could prove whether he's telling the truth or faking it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, you can throw that crap away because I can tell you right now that this guy's liar. He's playing a game.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, then let's just see how well he plays that game.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Why? So you can get suckered in even more? Listen to you two!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Listen, I'm telling ya. This guy threw this up for our benefit. He knew exactly what you'd say, he knew exactly what I'd say. He even knew that the two of you would be so blinded by this hocus pocus that you wouldn't see what's in front of your faces.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Reyes is just trying to get to the truth, okay? What are you doing?

speaker: REYES
line: Maybe this is a hoax. Maybe you're right. But now you're saying we should turn away from evidence? It's not like you, John. I don't understand why.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I already told you why.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully, I tried to reach you at Quantico.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm on my way back to DC. What is it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Kobold. He told the guard he knows where we can find Dr. Richmond.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, let's just say it sounds like a joke. Another game. It's a place called Happy Landing.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: On state road 710, near Annandale.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There-there's old marina there. I passed it on my way home, in fact I'm almost there right now.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: State road 710 near Annandale. All right, we're going to meet you there.

speaker: REYES
line: Where is she?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't know. But I know who does.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where is she, Professor?

speaker: KOBOLD
line: Game's over, Mr. Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Tell me where she is right now, you son of a bitch, I swear to God I'll kill you where you sit!

speaker: REYES
line: John...

speaker: KOBOLD
line: You lost.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where is she!!??

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, over here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't understand.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He held me at gunpoint until you arrived and then he shot himself.

speaker: REYES
line: It doesn't make sense.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yes, it does. Game's over.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Josef Kobold! Stop there! I'm armed! I will shoot!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uncertainty. Not matter how thorough the investigation, some doubts inevitably remain. Just as juries seek to convict beyond reasonable doubt, the forensic investigator will seek conclusions supported by a preponderance of evidence. Rarely will you encounter a case where all of the variables, all of the open questions, are fully answered.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll see you Monday.

speaker: REYES
line: Have you filed your report on the case yet?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was going to do it on my way home.

speaker: REYES
line: We'd rather you didn't.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We haven't accounted to Kobold's actions. Not all of them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But Agent Reyes told me that Kobold accessed information about all of us over the Internet. About Mulder too.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, that explains how he knew how we'd respond to the first killings. Why he staged them to look like Satanic ritual, to make sure that we would.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He wanted us on the case, we know that.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He bent everyone to think and do whatever he wanted.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But we know all this already. It was a game, every move was played out perfectly. Except the last one.

speaker: REYES
line: Not unless that was part of the game, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What, to get shot in the back?

speaker: REYES
line: No. Kobold's body still hasn't been found.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Kobold's dead. Agent Doggett shot him. We all saw that.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Did we? Think back to Agent Reyes' question - why didn't Kobold escape with the others when he had the chance? Why? Because he wanted to escape without anyone knowing he'd escaped, so that by the time it was discovered, he'd be too far away for anyone to find him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Satan.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Daemonicus. The beginning and the end of our case. The snake eating its own tail. We lost. Kobold told me so. He wanted us to see how brilliantly he played the game.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How thoroughly we lost. The first victims, Darren and Evelyn Mountjoy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Chosen from the phone book. For what reason?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No reason. Other than their names.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And the third victim?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The doctor. Monique Sampson. And the last. The man whose body is at the bottom of that river.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not Kobold.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The guard we assigned to him. The guard he knew he'd have when we transferred him.)

speaker: SCULLY
line: Custer.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Checkmate.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Something still bothering you, Agent Reyes? You don't believe this explanation?

speaker: REYES
line: It all makes sense to me as far as it goes. But there's something else, something he's afraid to explain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean that you felt the presence of evil?

speaker: REYES
line: No, I mean that he felt it, too.
